snippet: Jean-Victor Meyers, the grandson of Liliane Bettencourt, has been appointed to the board, beginning his role as the family heir.
abstract: Jean-Victor Meyers, the 25-year-old grandson of L'Oreal matriarch Liliane Bettencourt, has been appointed to the board, beginning his role as the family heir; Bettencourt gave up her board seat after a bitter family fight that captivated France; Meyers's entree onto the board comes at a pivotal time for the family and for the company, which had a record 20 billion euros in global sales in 2011. Photos (L)
lead_paragraph: PARIS ONE rainy morning in April, members of the Bettencourt family, heirs to the vast L'Oréal cosmetics fortune, strode into the Palais des Congrès de Paris, the grand convention center here, for a meeting with L'Oréal shareholders.
